newsitem.title: ALBANIA: IMF to send mission to Albania mid-March.
newsitem.headline: IMF to send mission to Albania mid-March.

text.p: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) will send a mission to Albania in the second week of March to hold talks with the government on the possibility of setting up a new loan programme, IMF sources said on Saturday.
"No decision has yet been taken but we will assess the situation and examine the possibility of aid," an IMF source in Tirana said.
Any new aid would be given to Albania's central bank as the IMF only makes loans to a nation's monetary authorities and not to governments, the source added.

Albania is facing serious economic and political difficulties following the collapse of a string of pyramid savings schemes in which experts estimate around $2 billion may have been invested nationwide.
Protests escalated on Friday when civilians and secret police officers clashed in the southern town of Vlore where nine people were reported killed.
